blog.description: Critical Role, Marvel, and various other fandoms & shitposts ~.~.~.~ will be tagging my various spoilers as ‘#got spoilers’ ‘#endgame spoilers’ ‘#avengers spoilers’ ‘#avengers endgame spoilers’ ‘#cr spoilers’ ‘#critical role spoilers’ so beware ~.~.~.~ banner by thrandurins

tags: i was so hyped for that duo
summary:
i don’t know when or how people collectively decided that jaime adopts arya but IM HERE FOR IT
SO LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT ALL THE...
body:
i don’t know when or how people collectively decided that jaime adopts arya but IM HERE FOR IT

SO LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT ALL THE WAYS I THOUGHT THEY’D INTERACT

  • Arya would see Jaime sparring losing to Brienne, or Jaime would see Arya and Brienne sparring, and one of them suggests Jaime spar with Arya after Brienne and he makes a joke about losing to two women in one day (cuz he’s self-depricating but actually p good, but Arya and Brienne are leagues better)
  • Arya would teach Jaime some Braavosi water dancing because that style favors one handed fighting (also they’re both left handed which is p neat in my opinion)
  • realistically, Arya would stalk up to him and threaten him with how she duped Tywin at Harrenhal, and how Jaime indirectly caused her mother’s death because of his release, but he genuinely respected Catelyn so he’d reply with how he wants to honor his oath to her to protect her daughters
  • the more Arya talks with Jaime, the more she realizes that he is nothing like the arrogant golden lion she first saw, he’s just a fucking sad old man and killing him is not worth her time cuz he probably wants to die anyways
  • both gushing about how badass Brienne and Sansa are
  • before this season, and after Arya became the Night King Slayer, I really wanted a Jaime & Arya tag team
  • like i imagined a scene where Jaime sneaks into the Red Keep but he gets caught and is like “fuck it we’re going with plan B” and Arya jumps down from the rafters and they both take down all the soldiers in their way (because Jaime is a better swordsman than he thinks he is)

I genuinely thought they’d have at least 1 scene together cuz they make such a good team but alas 😔

summary: What part of Arya's ending implies she's never coming back lol? If anything I think it implied the exact opposite
question: What part of Arya's ending implies she's never coming back lol? If anything I think it implied the exact opposite
answer:
The ending implies that the Starks are seperated. They may have survived but they can’t be together as a family with Jon going beyond the Wall into the true North with the Freefolk, Sansa becoming Queen of the North, Bran as King in the South and Arya leaving Westeros.

Jon tells Arya that she can come see him at Castle Black and she says “I can’t.” that she’s not going back North. By this statement they’re saying she’s never going to see her sister and beloved older brother ever again. This coupled with that in lore no one has crossed the Sunset Sea and returned makes the implication of Arya never returning or even possibly dying somewhere far from home. 

Granted, it’s a very open ending and I chose to interpet it as such because I find the underlying implications irritating.

blog.name: the-wolfofstormsend
blog.title: rich girl. assassin. top.
blog.description: I write fics about Gendrya. If you like lots of random Gendrya prompts and headcanons this is the tumblr for you.

summary: I’m still not over the whole proposal scene because honestly? I’d totally do something stupid like that too. If I was in love...
body:
I’m still not over the whole proposal scene because honestly? I’d totally do something stupid like that too. If I was in love with someone and reunited with them after years of thinking they were dead and then spent what was going to be my last night with them, found out that person killed the mother fucking Night King and was given a famous name, a castle and a lot of money I’d 100% be stupid enough to propose to the love of my life.

Gendry tried to lock that shit down after one night and I’d totally do the same thing. I’m still angry that’s how they finished Gendry and Arya’s storyline on the show but as a fellow stupid idiot… Gendry, I feel you.

tags: i own none of the gifs
arya and gendy as lord and lady of storm’s end gives me life
that little girl in Baratheon colors kills me
i swear all of this started with that gif of Rachael Weisz from The Mummy II and I went off
summary: Arya Stark (Rachael Weisz) sails the seas for years exploring what’s “West of Westeros” before returning all the more deadly and...
body:
Game of Thrones Epilogue Headcanons (Arya x Gendry)

Arya Stark (Rachael Weisz) sails the seas for years exploring what’s “West of Westeros” before returning all the more deadly and beautiful.

She first goes beyond the fallen wall to visit her favorite brother, Jon Snow (Eric Bana). He still grieves his Dragon Queen, but finds solace in the true North amongst the free folk.

Next she travels to Winterfell, where her sister, Sansa Stark (Cate Blanchett) sits as Queen in the North. Rebuilding the many losses the North suffered in the wars of their youth.

Her brother, Bran Stark (Ben Barnes), the Three-Eyed Raven, rules wisely over the remaining Six Kingdoms of Westeros. He tells Arya upon her visit to the rebuilt Kings Landing that although she has returned to Westeros she has not yet found her way home.

Traveling on the Kingsroad, Arya find herself at Storm’s End, keep of Lord Gendry Baratheon (Henry Cavill). The bastard-born smith turned lord is beloved by his people for his fairness as much as his ferocity in protecting the Stormlands.

Arya’s uncertain how the Stormlord will receive her, given the years that have passed and how she left things between them. But despite refusing his proposal, she found the stupid, stubborn bull was never very far from her thoughts, no matter how far she was from home.

Arya needn’t have worried, aye the bull was still stubborn, but he remained a dear friend. Gendry welcomed her as a guest of House Baratheon, and said she would always have a friend and ally in him.

It didn’t take long for the smallkfolk to observe the change in their lord. They had always admired and respected the solemn man, known for his quiet ways, superior strength, and skill in the forge. But they saw a new man upon the arrival of Lady Arya Stark. A man easier to smile, his laugh booming like thunder over Shipbreaker Bay.

Eventually, the Stag and She-Wolf wed before the Heart Tree in Storm’s End. Gendry wrapped a cloak around Arya’s shoulders and kissed her lips, knowing that she would be more than his Lady, she would be his family.

Their first born son, Davos, was kind and quiet, but possessed a true Baratheon temper in the face of injustice. He had his father’s dark hair, but his mother’s grey eyes. He enjoyed nothing so much as tales of adventure — his mother’s journey on the sea, or stories of his Uncle Jon beyond the wall.

Their daughter, Cassandra Baratheon, had her father’s blue eyes, but shared her mother’s wolf blood. She adored dresses, but was careless to ruin them practicing in the yard with her mother and her very own Needle — a small sword forged by her father with blunted steel on the occasion of her past nameday.

Arya never saw herself as a lady, but she could wear the mantle of She-Wolf. And the She-Wolf would always protect the pack.

blog.name: lizwontcry
blog.title: Baby, maybe, someday...
blog.description: If I was standing by you, how would you feel? Knowing your love's decided, and all love is real...

tags: I knew it wasn't going to happen but it would be cooler if it did
summary: Imagine with me, if you will: Arya on the boat with the Stark sails, setting forth to the West to see what others have not seen...
body: Imagine with me, if you will: Arya on the boat with the Stark sails, setting forth to the West to see what others have not seen yet. Behind her, somewhere on the boat, we see the Hound’s dog helmet in the background, because she wanted to take a little part of him with her, as he is the one who convinced her to choose life instead of revenge.

reblog.comment: Imagine with me, if you will: Arya on the boat with the Stark sails, setting forth to the West to see what others have not seen yet. Behind her, somewhere on the boat, we see the Hound’s dog helmet in the background, because she wanted to take a little part of him with her, as he is the one who convinced her to choose life instead of revenge.

Behind her, somewhere on the boat, we see the Hound’s dog helmet in the background, because she wanted to take a little part of him with her, as he is the one who convinced her to choose life instead of revenge.
trail.content: Imagine with me, if you will: Arya on the boat with the Stark sails, setting forth to the West to see what others have not seen yet. Behind her, somewhere on the boat, we see the Hound’s dog helmet in the background, because she wanted to take a little part of him with her, as he is the one who convinced her to choose life instead of revenge.

summary: Y’all wanna know why I think Arya’s ending where it’s implied that she’s leaving and never ever coming back is a bunch of...
body:
Y’all wanna know why I think Arya’s ending where it’s implied that she’s leaving and never ever coming back is a bunch of bullshit?

The whole point of her going to see what’s west of Westeros would be useless if she doesn’t come back to tell people. 

As that’s the point of exploration.

Essentially what they’re saying by trying to make seems as if Arya’s peacing out forever is that Arya is going to go die far away from home in the name of exploration like she’s Captain Cook. 

And I don’t buy that fucking shit at all. It’s not that i disagree with Arya leaving to explore. That’s pretty neat actually. What I resent is the lack of build up to it, the lack of anything with her and Gendry’s relationship and the implication that she’s not coming back. 

In short, D&D:

summary: Gendrya positivity squad, I need help!
body:
Gendrya positivity squad, I need help!

I was doing so much better and today I find myself sinking again, I don’t know why!

HELP ME, PLEASE!!! You’re my support group.

blog.name: ladyaryaofstormsend
blog.description: Arya sails to Storm’s End and marries Gendry. I don’t make the rules. 🤷🏻‍♀️

summary:
“Arya sailed away like Nymeria, the woman she named her direwolf after, so her ending on the show made sense”
I literally roll...
body:
“Arya sailed away like Nymeria, the woman she named her direwolf after, so her ending on the show made sense”

I literally roll my eyes whenever I see someone saying this and trying to justify the misogynistic and oversimplified shitheap D&D put out into the world. The same individuals also probably reckon romantic love should never be a thing for Arya because she doesn’t conform to gender norms, the irony of the fact that the character they are comparing her to also being a wife and a mother going straight over their heads.

It’s almost like D&D decided, due to their laziness and lack of understanding and respect for the characters they were writing, to tell only half the tale.
